title: Less-or-Equal is Transitive
description:
Prove the transitivity of the less-than-or-equal relation on natural numbers: if `n <= m` and `m <= p`, then `n <= p`.

**Goal:** `forall n m p : nat, n <= m -> m <= p -> n <= p`

This is a fundamental property of the `<=` ordering.
hints: Use `intros` to introduce `n`, `m`, `p`, and the two inequality hypotheses
The `le_trans` lemma is available from `Arith`, but try proving it with `induction` on one of the hypotheses
You can also use `apply (Nat.le_trans n m p)` or simply `lia`
prelude:
Require Import Arith.
Require Import Lia.
template:
Theorem le_transitive : forall n m p : nat, n <= m -> m <= p -> n <= p.
Proof.
  (* Your proof here *)
Admitted.
solution:
Theorem le_transitive : forall n m p : nat, n <= m -> m <= p -> n <= p.
Proof.
  intros n m p Hnm Hmp.
  lia.
Qed.
